javadoc: DBFieldIterator provides the ability to iterate over Field values within a table.

methods.javadoc:
Return true if a Field is available in the forward direction.
@throws IOException thrown if an IO error occurs
methods.name: hasNext
methods.comment: Return true if a Field is available in the forward direction.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs

methods.javadoc:
Return true if a Field is available in the reverse direction
@throws IOException thrown if an IO error occurs
methods.name: hasPrevious
methods.comment: Return true if a Field is available in the reverse direction

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs

methods.javadoc:
Return the next Field value or null if one is not available.
@throws IOException thrown if an IO error occurs
methods.name: next
methods.comment: Return the next Field value or null if one is not available.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs

methods.javadoc:
Return the previous Field value or null if one is not available.
@throws IOException thrown if an IO error occurs
methods.name: previous
methods.comment: Return the previous Field value or null if one is not available.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs

methods.name: delete
methods.comment:
Delete the last record(s) associated with the last Field value
 read via the next or previous methods.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs.

return.comment: true if record(s) was successfully deleted.

name: DBFieldIterator
comment:
DBFieldIterator provides the ability to iterate over
 Field values within a table.
